unnormalised: Navigating the Wonderful, Weird World of Obstetrics and Gynecology!
normalised: Navigating the Wonderful, Weird World of Obstetrics and Gynecology!

unnormalised: So, you're expecting, huh? Congrats! Get ready for a whirlwind of emotions, cravings for *aloo paratha* at 3 AM, and appointments, oh, the appointments! You’ll be spending more time in your OB-GYN's office than at your favourite chai stall. And trust me, you'll develop a special relationship with your doctor... the kind where you discuss bodily functions more freely than you would with your own mother. Remember that first ultrasound? That blurry blob on the screen cost Rs. 2500 and suddenly, you were obsessed with its well-being. Good times!
normalised: So, you're expecting, huh? Congrats! Get ready for a whirlwind of emotions, cravings for *aloo paratha* at three A-M, and appointments, oh, the appointments! You’ll be spending more time in your O-B-G-Y-N's office than at your favourite chai stall. And trust me, you'll develop a special relationship with your doctor... the kind where you discuss bodily functions more freely than you would with your own mother. Remember that first ultrasound? That blurry blob on the screen cost rupees two thousand five hundred and suddenly, you were obsessed with its well-being. Good times!

unnormalised: Speaking of appointments, get ready for the "gestational age" game. You'll hear things like "You're 12 wks along," and suddenly you're back in school, trying to decipher some complicated maths equation. And don't even get me started on the Glucose Tolerance Test. Drinking that sickly sweet concoction feels like a punishment for all those *gulab jamuns* you devoured during Diwali. My advice? Pretend you’re a contestant in ‘Fear Factor’ and chug that thing down! Dr. Sharma always says, "It's only for the baby, beta!"
normalised: Speaking of appointments, get ready for the "gestational age" game. You'll hear things like "You're twelve weeks along," and suddenly you're back in school, trying to decipher some complicated maths equation. And don't even get me started on the Glucose Tolerance Test. Drinking that sickly sweet concoction feels like a punishment for all those *gulab jamuns* you devoured during Diwali. My advice? Pretend you’re a contestant in ‘Fear Factor’ and chug that thing down! Doctor Sharma always says, "It's only for the baby, beta!"

unnormalised: Then there are the fun abbreviations. HCG, AFP, NIPT... it's like learning a new language. You'll find yourself Googling them at 2 AM, convinced something is terribly wrong, only to discover it's all perfectly normal. And let's not forget the weight gain. Suddenly, those kilos seem to attach themselves in places you never thought possible. But hey, you're growing a human! Reward yourself with extra butter chicken, you deserve it! Maybe even two portions.
normalised: Then there are the fun abbreviations. H-C-G, A-F-P, N-I-P-T... it's like learning a new language. You'll find yourself Googling them at two A-M, convinced something is terribly wrong, only to discover it's all perfectly normal. And let's not forget the weight gain. Suddenly, those kilos seem to attach themselves in places you never thought possible. But hey, you're growing a human! Reward yourself with extra butter chicken, you deserve it! Maybe even two portions.

unnormalised: The crowning glory? The delivery itself! Whether it's a "normal" delivery or a C-section (scheduled for 16/05/2024, perhaps?), it's an experience you'll never forget. Just remember to pack your sense of humour, a good book (because labor can take a while!), and maybe a picture of your favorite Bollywood star to keep you motivated. And pray that the hospital Wi-Fi is working, because you'll want to Instagram that little bundle of joy ASAP!
normalised: The crowning glory? The delivery itself! Whether it's a "normal" delivery or a C-section (scheduled for sixteenth May two thousand and twenty four, perhaps?), it's an experience you'll never forget. Just remember to pack your sense of humour, a good book (because labor can take a while!), and maybe a picture of your favorite Bollywood star to keep you motivated. And pray that the hospital Wi-Fi is working, because you'll want to Instagram that little bundle of joy A-S-A-P!

unnormalised: So, buckle up, buttercup! This journey is going to be a wild ride, filled with highs, lows, and moments you'll cherish forever. Just remember to laugh along the way and trust your instincts. And if all else fails, blame it on the hormones! After all, you're doing the most amazing thing: bringing a new life into this crazy, wonderful world. Now go get that *aloo paratha*!
normalised: So, buckle up, buttercup! This journey is going to be a wild ride, filled with highs, lows, and moments you'll cherish forever. Just remember to laugh along the way and trust your instincts. And if all else fails, blame it on the hormones! After all, you're doing the most amazing thing: bringing a new life into this crazy, wonderful world. Now go get that *aloo paratha*!
